file_content.text: I warned her if the Imperials didn't get her, the escaped convicts would. Enna didn't listen.
Thank you for believing in me.
Not fond of the cage, but it's just until this all gets sorted out.
Pak, I fixed all the monitoring stations. Locate Doctor Gantrell.
On it. Scanning now....
Found his tracking signal. He and his team are in an underground containment vault.
Sending you the coordinates now. I hope you get there before Krannus.
You need to repair the monitoring stations so we can find Doctor Gantrell.
I'm picking up lots of chatter on the comm network. Here, listen to this....
Alert, alert--this is Doctor Gantrell. Our sector is overrun. We've taken refuge inside one of the unused containment vaults.
This is the only distress call we can send. Can't risk those blood-skinned fiends tracking our signal. Doctor Gantrell out.
Sounds like he's describing Executor Krannus.
Blood-skinned fiends... hmm.
What does Doctor Gantrell do for the prison? Is he a medic?
Who's Doctor Gantrell?
No. A scientist.
Any idea which vault those people are hiding in?
It's not much to go on.
Doctor Gantrell and his team were working in the high security wing. Clearance way beyond my position.
They all have sub-dermal tracking chips, so the Republic can locate them in an emergency.
Doctor Gantrell must have figured we'd use the chips to find which vault they're hiding in.
Just give me the coordinates.
Let's do it.
It sounds like that isn't an option anymore.
Is there a problem?
I've got a bad feeling about this. What if Krannus is setting us up?
This could be a trap.
We either pursue this, or sit here and wait for Krannus to blow up the planet.
The Imperials disabled all the monitoring stations, but if you repair them, I can pinpoint Doctor Gantrell's location.
I want to find him before Krannus does.
We'd better hurry.
If Krannus already found him, Doctor Gantrell is probably dead.
I hope we're not too late.
We can't afford to waste time chasing our tails.
This lead had better pay off.
We still don't know the Imperials plan to destroy Belsavis, but there must be a reason he's after Doctor Gantrell.
Call me when you get the monitoring stations up and running. I'll use them to locate the doctor.
Pak, the ion charges are all in place. Take down that Sith ray shield.
I read you. Detonating the ion charges... now.
That cleared the way. Now comes the fun part--taking on Sith heavy weapons. Good luck. I'll be standing by.
Plant those ion charges at the power relays. It's the only way to disable the Sith shields.
Whoa, hold on. You're the Jedi who was supposed to meet Enna, right?
I know what this looks like, but I told her to wait for you. She wanted to go outside, scout the area.
I want your name and rank, soldier.
Tell me who you are.
I'm not a soldier. Name's Pak Taldine. I work here.
I thought you'd show a little more emotion over the death of your friend.
You don't sound very upset.
Hey, I barely knew her. I just work here. Name's Pak Taldine.
You're the only one with her. It doesn't look good.
I think you're lying.
You're a Jedi. Can't you read my thoughts? I'm telling the truth.
Only someone telling the truth would ever make that offer.
That won't be necessary.
I have no choice. I need your help to complete my mission.
I guess I have to trust you.
Glad we're on the same page. Name's Pak Taldine. I work here.
We can't read minds... but I'll make your head explode like an overripe melon if you cross me.
No, but I'm watching you.
I'll keep that in mind. Pak Taldine. I work here.
Enna heard I know Belsavis better than anyone and asked me to help her.
I had no idea what I was signing up for. Now I just want to get out of this alive.
I appreciate you waiting for me. You could've left when Enna died.
Glad you stuck around.
Thought about it--but you've been out there. Where would I go?
I know what the prisoners would do to me, and the Imperials are worse. Figured I might as well stay.
Based on what Enna said, you'll need all the help you can get.
Jedi aren't easy to kill. What happened to Enna?
How did she die?
She crawled back from her scouting mission, wounded and barely alive. Said she escaped from an Imperial patrol.
I tried to help her, but I'm not a med-tech.
She told me everything she learned out there, right up to her last breath. None of it was good news.
I'm not like Enna. I can get the job done by myself.
I don't need your help.
You may not need me, but you're my best chance of survival.
Based on what Enna said before she died, it's bad out there. We should stick together.
I'm looking for an Imperial officer. A red-skinned Sith.
Did she mention Krannus?
Give me a status report.
How bad are things here?
Enna might have been overmatched here, but I'm a lot stronger than she was.
I think I can handle Belsavis.
The least I can do is tell you what you're up against.
Enna told me the Imperials are entrenched by the main reactor. They were taking orders from a pureblood Sith.
They have heavy weapons and a ray shield protecting their position. Nobody's moving them from that reactor any time soon.
If Krannus is at the reactor, then we've got to find some way to get by those defenses.
We need a plan.
Why are the Imperials so determined to hold that position?
What does the reactor do?
The reactor controls the security gates. The Imperials are sending troops deeper into the prison and making it impossible for us to follow them.
Even with an entire army; they don't stand a chance against a Jedi.
They're no match for me.
That's what Enna thought.
You'll never get past the Imperials' shields before their heavy weapons mow you down. We need a plan.
What if we take out the shields?
Simple plans work best.
You know this prison. Got any bright ideas?
Any suggestions?
There might be one thing we could try.
You've never seen me in action. I make my plans up as I go.
I'll improvise.
You try and smash your way through, you'll die. Let's be smart about this.
If you overload the energy relays feeding the sector's power grid, you could knock down that ray shield.
We've got ion charges here. We could plant one at each power relay, detonate them simultaneously... and short out the Imperial defenses.
Give me the ion charges. Keep an eye on Enna's remains. See they're treated with respect.
I'll do this. You stay here.
Contact me when all the charges are in place. I'll detonate them from this control room.
I thought you'd want to stay hidden here.
Are you coming with me?
I'm not going anywhere. You're the Jedi--you plant the charges. I'll detonate them from here when you give the all-clear.
Let's get one thing straight: I'm the hero. You're just a guy who needs to stay out of my way.
"We"? We're not a team, Pak.
Are you kidding? I'm not leaving this room. Wouldn't last two heartbeats out there.
I can detonate those charges from here once they're all in place. Just say the word.
Good luck--and watch your back.
